name: CancelOrder
description:
Cancel a complete order or a subset of lines.

The order can be identified by an OrderID or by BackendID + BackendSystemID, the lines can be identified by an OrderLineID or by BackendID.

The result will tell you if it was successful.

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

C.name: BackendID
C.description: Reference to the orderline that is being cancelled - required when `OrderLineID` is omitted

C.name: OrderLineID
C.description:
ID of the orderline that is being cancelled - required when `BackendID` is omitted

This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

C.name: Quantity
C.description: Quantity to be cancelled. If left blank the full order line will be cancelled

B.name: BackendID
B.description: Reference to the order that is being cancelled - required when `OrderID` is omitted

B.name: BackendSystemID
B.description: Reference to the system from which the order originated - required when `OrderID` is omitted

B.name: Force
B.description:
Forcing cancellations is not recommended! Requires `ForceCancelOrder` functionality.

      Only use this when a normal cancellation does not work, because the exported party (warehouse) does not accept it, and they have agreed that
      they too will manually cancel it in their systems. This will skip all external validation and cause discrepancies in this order status and stock levels.

B.name: OrderID
B.description:
ID of the order that is being cancelled - required when `BackendID` and `BackendSystemID` are omitted

This is the ID of a `Order`

B.name: OrderLines
B.description: Lines to cancel - or, if none are specified, all open lines of the order will be cancelled

E.name: Code
E.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

E.name: Message
E.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

E.name: RequestID
E.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

E.name: Type
E.description: A short description of the error type.

F.name: ExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

F.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
F.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

F.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

D.name: Result
D.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - CanBeCancelled
* `1` - AlreadyCancelled
* `2` - ShouldBeRequested
* `3` - MustBeRequested
* `4` - CannotBeCancelled
